dmca.title: Fwd: [ABUSE] [URGENT] Illegal Distribution of Apple Computer Copyrighted Material --
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Thursday, February 23, 2006 7:52 AM
To: copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: Fwd: [ABUSE] [URGENT] Illegal Distribution of Apple Computer
Copyrighted Material -- Immediate Action Demanded

This message was received at abuse@theplanet.com on Wednesday, February 22,
2006 at
7:58:13 PM and concerns a matter for which responsibility is delegated to
your team. The message and headers follow.

Thank you,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/

SUBJECT:
[ABUSE] [URGENT] Illegal Distribution of Apple Computer Copyrighted Material
-- Immediate Action Demanded

MESSAGE BODY:

February 22, 2006

VIA E-MAIL

NOT FOR POSTING


Re: Apple Computer Copyrighted Material Illegally Distributed by
http://maxxuss.batcave.net


To Whom It May Concern:

We represent Apple Computer, Inc.  A website that you host,
http://maxxuss.batcave.net, is currently distributing software that allows
for the unauthorized installation of Apple's Mac OS X operating system on a
generic x86 computer.  This software contains decrypted versions of
encryption-protected files that Apple distributes with Mac OS X version
10.4.  These files are copyrighted and contain Apple's trade secrets.  Apple
protects these files with encryption keys specific to a single end-user
purchaser.  Any unauthorized use or distribution of these files is strictly
prohibited, and violates your acceptable use policy
(http://theplanet.com/legal/index.html).  

Apple demands that you take steps to immediately disable
http://maxxuss.batcave.net and any applicable mirror sites.  Failure to do
so may subject you to criminal and civil liability.  Please notify me by
reply e-mail as soon as the site has been disabled.  

Apple is prepared to take further action with regards to this matter, and
expressly reserves its rights to do so.  If you have any questions or
concerns, do not hesitate to contact me at the number below. 


Thank you in advance for your cooperation,

Ian N. Ramage

O'MELVENY & MYERS LLP
Embarcadero Center West
275 Battery Street
San Francisco, CA 94111-3305
(415) 984-8783 (direct)
(415) 984-8701 (fax)


Certification:  Pursuant to 17 U.S.C.
